specs.description: A parameter that influences the algorithms and heuristics for the flush operation for the InnoDB buffer pool.
specs.name: innodb_lru_scan_depth

specs.description: The amount in bytes by which to increase a per-transaction memory pool which needs memory.
specs.name: transaction_alloc_block_size

specs.description: Write a core file if mysqld dies.
specs.name: core-file

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented condition objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_cond_instances

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented socket objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_socket_instances

specs.description: Maximum amount of memory (in bytes) the TempTable storage engine is allowed to allocate from the main memory (RAM) before starting to store data on disk.
specs.name: temptable_max_ram

specs.description: A fully qualified path to the public RSA key used for authentication.
specs.name: caching_sha2_password_public_key_path

specs.description: This variable controls the timestamp time zone of error log messages, and of general query log and slow query log messages written to files.
specs.name: log_timestamps

specs.description: Larger value improves perf for ORDER BY or GROUP BY operations.
specs.name: sort_buffer_size

specs.description: Specifies the path, file name, and file size for InnoDB temporary table tablespace data files.
specs.name: innodb_temp_data_file_path

specs.description: Maximum size to which MEMORY tables are allowed to grow.
specs.name: max_heap_table_size

specs.description: Whether to use compression of the slave/master protocol if both the slave and the master support it.
specs.name: slave_compressed_protocol

specs.description: Number of server errors instrumented.
specs.name: performance_schema_error_size

specs.description: Whether to load persisted configuration settings from the mysqld-auto.cnf file in the data directory.
specs.name: persisted_globals_load

specs.description: This variable controls the block encryption mode for block-based algorithms such as AES. It affects encryption for AES_ENCRYPT() and AES_DECRYPT().
specs.name: block_encryption_mode

specs.description: Causes InnoDB to automatically recalculate persistent statistics after the data in a table is changed substantially.
specs.name: innodb_stats_auto_recalc

specs.description: The maximum number of opened file objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_file_handles

specs.description: Auto generate RSA keys at server startup if corresponding system variables are not specified and key files are not present at the default location.
specs.name: caching_sha2_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys

specs.description: If the queue becomes full, any client that issues an INSERT DELAYED statement waits until there is room in the queue again.
specs.name: delayed_queue_size

specs.description: How the server treats NULL values when collecting statistics about the distribution of index values for InnoDB tables.
specs.name: innodb_stats_method

specs.description: The relative or absolute directory path where InnoDB creates separate tablespaces for the undo logs
specs.name: innodb_undo_directory

specs.description: Logs queries that are expected to retrieve all rows to slow query log
specs.name: log_queries_not_using_indexes

specs.description: If an in-memory temporary table exceeds the limit, MySQL automatically converts it to an on-disk MyISAM table. Increased value can improve perf for many advanced GROUP BY queries.
specs.name: tmp_table_size

specs.description: Low water mark representing percentage of dirty pages where preflushing is enabled to control the dirty page ratio.
specs.name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct_lwm

specs.description: If the value of this variable is greater than 0, a replication slave synchronizes its relay-log.info file to disk (using fdatasync()) after every sync_relay_log_info transactions.
specs.name: sync_relay_log_info

specs.description: When the slow query log is enabled, this variable enables logging for queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute on the slave.
specs.name: log_slow_slave_statements

specs.description: The execution timeout for SELECT statements, in milliseconds.
specs.name: max_execution_time

specs.description: The maximum number of memory instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_memory_classes

specs.description: Ignore character set information sent by the client.
specs.name: skip-character-set-client-handshake

specs.description: Determines the starting point for the AUTO_INCREMENT column value
specs.name: auto_increment_offset

specs.description: Server current time zone
specs.name: default_time_zone

specs.description: Determines Innodb flush method
specs.name: innodb_flush_method

specs.description: Defines a threshold size for undo tablespaces.
specs.name: innodb_max_undo_log_size

specs.description: The number of rows per thread in the events_stages_history table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_stages_history_size

specs.description: How long in microseconds to keep reading transactions from the flush queue before proceeding with the group commit (and syncing the log to disk, if sync_binlog is greater than 0). If the value is 0 (the default), there is no timeout and the server keeps reading new transactions until the queue is empty.
specs.name: binlog_max_flush_queue_time

specs.description: The character set for statements that arrive from the client.
specs.name: character_set_client

specs.description: Defines the path to the mecabrc configuration file.
specs.name: mecab_rc_file

specs.description: The amount of preallocated memory per thread used to hold connection attribute strings.
specs.name: performance_schema_session_connect_attrs_size

specs.description: The character set used by the default database.
specs.name: character_set_database

specs.description: Specifies an upper limit on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables.
specs.name: innodb_online_alter_log_max_size

specs.description: Synonym for max_delayed_threads
specs.name: max_insert_delayed_threads

specs.description: ORDER BY Optimization. The cutoff on the size of index values that determines which filesort algorithm to use.
specs.name: max_length_for_sort_data

specs.description: The number of open tables for all threads. Increasing this value increases the number of file descriptors.
specs.name: table_open_cache

specs.description: The set of all GTIDs that have been purged from the binary log
specs.name: gtid_purged

specs.description: Relevant only if you use multiple tablespaces in innodb. It specifies the maximum number of .ibd files that innodb can keep open at one time
specs.name: innodb_open_files

specs.description: Controls whether or not MySQL uses Linux native asynchronous IO.
specs.name: innodb_use_native_aio

specs.description: Controls whether the mysql_native_password and sha256_password built-in authentication plugins support proxy users.
specs.name: check_proxy_users

specs.description: The server's default collation.
specs.name: collation_server

specs.description: Specifies how long in milliseconds (ms) a block inserted into the old sublist must stay there after its first access before it can be moved to the new sublist.
specs.name: innodb_old_blocks_time

specs.description: Enables or disables periodic output for the standard InnoDB Monitor.
specs.name: innodb_status_output

specs.description: Controls whether GTID based logging is enabled and what type of transactions the logs can contain
specs.name: gtid-mode

specs.description: This option causes the server to log its relay log info to a file or a table.
specs.name: relay_log_info_repository

specs.description: Allows INSERT and SELECT statements to run concurrently for MyISAM tables that have no free blocks in the middle of the data file.
specs.name: concurrent_insert

specs.description: This option causes the server to write its master info log to a file or a table.
specs.name: master-info-repository

specs.description: Stack size limit for regular expressions matches.
specs.name: regexp_stack_limit

specs.description: The maximum delay between polls for a spin lock.
specs.name: innodb_spin_wait_delay

specs.description: The number of I/O threads for write operations in InnoDB.
specs.name: innodb_write_io_threads

specs.description: Maximum number of rows to keep in the writeset history.
specs.name: binlog_transaction_dependency_history_size

specs.description: Defines the maximum number of doublewrite pages per thread for a batch write. If no value is specified, innodb_doublewrite_pages is set to the innodb_write_io_threads value.
specs.name: innodb_doublewrite_pages

specs.description: The InnoDB FULLTEXT search (FTS) query result cache limit (defined in bytes) per FTS query or per thread.
specs.name: innodb_ft_result_cache_limit

specs.description: The limit up to which InnoDB is allowed to extend the innodb_io_capacity setting in case of emergency.
specs.name: innodb_io_capacity_max

specs.description: Changes the way the OPTIMIZE TABLE statement operates on InnoDB tables.
specs.name: innodb_optimize_fulltext_only

specs.description: The maximum number of rows in the events_statements_summary_by_digest table.
specs.name: performance_schema_digests_size

specs.description: The number of seconds that the MySQLd server waits for a connect packet before responding with Bad handshake.
specs.name: connect_timeout

specs.description: Controls how the server handles clients with expired passwords:
specs.name: disconnect_on_expired_password

specs.description: Whether the general query log is enabled
specs.name: general_log

specs.description: This option is used to disable deadlock detection.
specs.name: innodb_deadlock_detect

specs.description: Number of digits by which to increase the scale of the result of division operations.
specs.name: div_precision_increment

specs.description: Name of the table containing a list of words to ignore when creating an InnoDB FULLTEXT index, in the format db_name/table_name.
specs.name: innodb_ft_server_stopword_table

specs.description: Controls whether the sha256_password built-in authentication plugin supports proxy users.
specs.name: sha256_password_proxy_users

specs.description: The number of statements for which to maintain profiling if profiling is enabled.
specs.name: profiling_history_size

specs.description: The number of seconds after which mysqld server will fetch data from storage engine and replace the data in cache.
specs.name: information_schema_stats_expiry

specs.description: If tablespace map files are lost or corrupted, the innodb_scan_directories startup option can be used to specify tablespace file directories. This option causes InnoDB to read the first page of each tablespace file in the specified directories and recreate tablespace map files so that the recovery process can apply redo logs to affected tablespaces.
specs.name: innodb_scan_directories

specs.description: Controls optimizations during statement tracing.
specs.name: optimizer_trace_features

specs.description: Causes SYSYDATE() to be an alias for NOW(). Replication related
specs.name: sysdate-is-now

specs.description: The number of page cleaner threads that flush dirty pages from buffer pool instances.
specs.name: innodb_page_cleaners

specs.description: The time when the current transaction was committed on the originating replication master, measured in microseconds since the epoch.
specs.name: original_commit_timestamp

specs.description: The maximum number of thread instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_thread_classes

specs.description: Creates a replication filter using the name of a database
specs.name: replicate-do-db

specs.description: The password policy enforced by the validate_password plugin.
specs.name: validate_password_policy

specs.description: Location of mysql general log.
specs.name: general_log_file

specs.description: Enables or disables the InnoDB Lock Monitor.
specs.name: innodb_status_output_locks

specs.description: Controls the demotion of buffers from the hot sub-chain of a key cache to the warm sub-chain. Lower values cause demotion to happen more quickly.
specs.name: key_cache_age_threshold

specs.description: The time in seconds after which a previous query sample is considered old. When the value is 0, queries are sampled once. When the value is greater than zero, queries are re sampled if the last sample is more than performance_schema_max_digest_sample_age seconds old.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_digest_sample_age

specs.description: Controls how binary logs are iterated during GTID recovery
specs.name: binlog_gtid_simple_recovery

specs.description: Increase the value of join_buffer_size to get a faster full join when adding indexes is not possible.
specs.name: join_buffer_size

specs.description: The number of bytes to use when sorting BLOB or TEXT values.
specs.name: max_sort_length

specs.description: The list of permissible ciphers for encrypted connections that use TLSv1.3.
specs.name: tls_ciphersuites

specs.description: Do not start more than this number of threads to handle INSERT DELAYED statements.
specs.name: max_delayed_threads

specs.description: The maximum number of stage instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_stage_classes

specs.description: The number of old passwords to check in the history. Set to 0 (the default) to turn the checks off.
specs.name: password_history

specs.description: The default authentication plugin
specs.name: default_authentication_plugin

specs.description: Enables per-index compression-related statistics in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.INNODB_CMP_PER_INDEX table.
specs.name: innodb_cmp_per_index_enabled

specs.description: Maximum percentage of dirty pages in the buffer pool
specs.name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct

specs.description: Controls binary logging.
specs.name: log-bin

specs.description: Write and flush the logs every N seconds. This setting has an effect only when innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit has a value of 2.
specs.name: innodb_flush_log_at_timeout

specs.description: (UNIX) socket file and (WINDOWS) named pipe used for local connections.
specs.name: socket

specs.description: When this option is enabled, it increases the verbosity of 'SHOW CREATE TABLE'.
specs.name: show_create_table_verbosity

specs.description: smartengine enable
specs.name: smartengine

specs.description: Specifies the qualified name of an InnoDB table containing a FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: innodb_ft_aux_table

specs.description: Enable old-style user limits.
specs.name: old-style-user-limits

specs.description: The number of rows in the events_statements_history_long table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_statements_history_long_size

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented file objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_file_instances

specs.description: Specifies whether images of re-compressed pages are stored in InnoDB redo logs.
specs.name: innodb_log_compressed_pages

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented rwlock objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_rwlock_instances

specs.description: The number of rows in the setup_objects table.
specs.name: performance_schema_setup_objects_size

specs.description: Sets the number of slave worker threads for executing replication events (transactions) in parallel. Setting this variable to 0 (the default) disables parallel execution.
specs.name: slave_parallel_workers

specs.description: Defines how many of the rollback segments in the system tablespace that InnoDB uses within a transaction.
specs.name: innodb_rollback_segments

specs.description: Undo tablespaces that exceed the threshold value defined by innodb_max_undo_log_size are marked for truncation.
specs.name: innodb_undo_log_truncate

specs.description: The maximum number of rows to return from SELECT statements.
specs.name: sql_select_limit

specs.description: Whether to enable additional full-text search (FTS) diagnostic output.
specs.name: innodb_ft_enable_diag_print

specs.description: Include slow administrative statements in the statements written to the slow query log.
specs.name: log_slow_admin_statements

specs.description: The maximum number of metadata lock instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_metadata_locks

specs.description: Defines the n-gram token size for the n-gram full-text parser.
specs.name: ngram_token_size

specs.description: When enabled, it causes a MySQL 5.6.2 or later server to write informational log events such as row query log events into its binary log.
specs.name: binlog_rows_query_log_events

specs.description: If enabled, this variable disables the operating system file system cache for merge-sort temporary files.
specs.name: innodb_disable_sort_file_cache

specs.description: The number of tablespace files that the undo logs are divided between, when you use a non-zero innodb_undo_logs setting.
specs.name: innodb_undo_tablespaces

specs.description: Creates a replication filter using the name of a table
specs.name: replicate-do-table

specs.description: If non-zero, binary logs will be purged after expire_logs_days days; If this option alone is set on the command line or in a configuration file, it overrides the default value for binlog-expire-logs-seconds. If both options are set to nonzero values, binlog-expire-logs-seconds takes priority. Possible purges happen at startup and at binary log rotation.
specs.name: binlog_expire_logs_seconds

specs.description: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE.
specs.name: innodb_stats_transient_sample_pages

specs.description: The maximum depth of search performed by the query optimizer.
specs.name: optimizer_search_depth

specs.description: Directory searched by systems dynamic linker for UDF object files. Otherwise, user-defined function object files must be located the default directory.
specs.name: plugin_dir

specs.description: The number of outstanding connection requests MySQL can have
specs.name: back_log

specs.description: The maximum number of I/O operations per second that InnoDB will perform.
specs.name: innodb_io_capacity

specs.description: smartengine enable
specs.name: loose_smartengine

specs.description: The number of rows in the Performance Schema accounts table.
specs.name: performance_schema_accounts_size

specs.description: The default storage engine (table type).
specs.name: default_storage_engine

specs.description: The maximum number of socket instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_socket_classes

specs.description: Whether the server tracks changes to the session state and notifies the client when changes occur.
specs.name: session_track_state_change

specs.description: Controls the limit on trace retention.
specs.name: optimizer_trace_limit

specs.description: The MySQL installation base directory.
specs.name: basedir

specs.description: Defines the global automatic password expiration policy.
specs.name: default_password_lifetime

specs.description: Defines the percentage of space on each B-tree page that is filled during a sorted index build, with the remaining space reserved for future index growth.
specs.name: innodb_fill_factor

specs.description: All the specified roles are always considered granted to every user and they can't be revoked. Mandatory roles still require activation unless they are made into default roles. The granted roles will not be visible in the mysql.role_edges table.
specs.name: mandatory_roles

specs.description: When enabled, this variable causes the master to write a checksum for each event in the binary log.
specs.name: binlog_checksum

specs.description: The size in bytes of each log file in a log group
specs.name: innodb_log_file_size

specs.description: If a read on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up. This value should be set quite high on freebsd because internal interrupts are sent to all threads.
specs.name: net_retry_count

specs.description: Enable parallel execution on the slave of all uncommitted threads already in the prepare phase, without violating consistency.
specs.name: slave_preserve_commit_order

specs.description: Whether optimizer JSON output should add end markers.
specs.name: end_markers_in_json

specs.description: Compress the mysql.gtid_executed table each time this many transactions have taken place.
specs.name: gtid_executed_compression_period

specs.description: The size of the internal host cache.
specs.name: host_cache_size

specs.description: Affects how the server handles identifier case sensitivity
specs.name: lower_case_table_names

specs.description: Specifies whether to record the pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool when the MySQL server is shut down.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown

specs.description: Directory where innodb files are stored
specs.name: innodb_data_home_dir

specs.description: The maximum number of bytes used to store SQL statements in the SQL_TEXT column of the events_statements_current, events_statements_history, and events_statements_history_long statement event tables.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_sql_text_length

specs.description: The replication thread delay (in ms) on a slave server if innodb_thread_concurrency is reached.
specs.name: innodb_replication_delay

specs.description: The size in bytes of the buffer that innodb uses to write to the log files on disk
specs.name: innodb_log_buffer_size

specs.description: Controls whether to enable FIPS mode on the server side.
specs.name: ssl_fips_mode

specs.description: Sets the default transaction isolation level.
specs.name: transaction_isolation

specs.description: Number of threads to be cached. Doesn't improve perf for good thread implementations.
specs.name: thread_cache_size

specs.description: Defines the chunk size for online InnoDB buffer pool resizing operations.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_chunk_size

specs.description: Can be used to cause queries which examine fewer than the stated number of rows not to be logged.
specs.name: min_examined_row_limit

specs.description: Sets the maximum time (in milliseconds) that is allowed to pass before a checkpoint operation is called to update the status of a multi-threaded slave as shown by SHOW SLAVE STATUS.
specs.name: slave_checkpoint_period

specs.description: For multithreaded slaves, this option sets the maximum amount of memory (in bytes) available to slave worker queues holding events not yet applied.
specs.name: slave_pending_jobs_size_max

specs.description: Current SQL Server Mode.
specs.name: sql_mode

specs.description: Defines the frequency with which the purge system frees rollback segments.
specs.name: innodb_purge_rseg_truncate_frequency

specs.description: Specifies the sizes of several buffers used for sorting data during creation of an InnoDB index.
specs.name: innodb_sort_buffer_size

specs.description: Whether MySQL writes binary log events using a Version 1 or Version 2 logging events
specs.name: log_bin_use_v1_row_events

specs.description: The size for reads done from the binlog and relay log. It must be a multiple of 4kb. Making it larger might help with IO stalls while reading these files when they are not in the OS buffer cache.
specs.name: rpl_read_size

specs.description: slave_exec_mode controls how a replication thread resolves conflicts and errors during replication.
specs.name: slave_exec_mode

specs.description: Controls what happens when the server cannot write to the binary log.
specs.name: binlog_error_action

specs.description: Determines when keys are flushed for MyISAM tables
specs.name: delay_key_write

specs.description: Defines the number of doublewrite files.
specs.name: innodb_doublewrite_files

specs.description: Defines the minimum amount of CPU usage below which user threads no longer spin while waiting for flushed redo.
specs.name: innodb_log_spin_cpu_abs_lwm

specs.description: The locking mode to use for generating auto-increment values
specs.name: innodb_autoinc_lock_mode

specs.description: Enable this debug option to reset DDL log crash injection counters to 1.
specs.name: innodb_ddl_log_crash_reset_debug

specs.description: The number of seconds to wait on TCP/IP connections for a block to be written before aborting the write.
specs.name: net_write_timeout

specs.description: Low water mark representing percentage of redo log capacity at which adaptive flushing is enabled.
specs.name: innodb_adaptive_flushing_lwm

specs.description: Controls InnoDB change buffering
specs.name: innodb_change_buffering

specs.description: The division point between the hot and warm sub-chains of the key cache buffer chain. The value is the percentage of the buffer chain to use for the warm sub-chain.
specs.name: key_cache_division_limit

specs.description: Each thread that does a sequential scan allocates this buffer. Increased value may help perf if performing many sequential scans.
specs.name: read_buffer_size

specs.description: The maximum size of the temporary file that MySQL is allowed to use while re-creating a MyISAM index
specs.name: myisam_max_sort_file_size

specs.description: If this variable is enabled (the default), transactions are committed in the same order they are written to the binary log. If disabled, transactions may be committed in parallel.
specs.name: binlog_order_commits

specs.description: Controls whether the server autogenerates RSA private/public key-pair files in the data directory.
specs.name: sha256_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys

specs.description: Enable parallel execution on the slave of all uncommitted threads already in the prepare phase, without violating consistency.
specs.name: slave_parallel_type

specs.description: When this option is enabled, the slave examines checksums read from the relay log, in the event of a mismatch, the slave stops with an error.
specs.name: slave_sql_verify_checksum

specs.description: If ON, the server flushes all changes to disk after each SQL statement.
specs.name: flush

specs.description: Controls verbosity of the server in writing error, warning, and note messages to the error log.
specs.name: log_error_verbosity

specs.description: How the server treats NULL values when collecting statistics about the distribution of index values for MyISAM tables
specs.name: myisam_stats_method

specs.description: Limits the effect of LOAD_FILE(), LOAD_DATA, and SELECT ??? INTO OUTFILE to specified directory.
specs.name: secure_file_priv

specs.description: The character set used for returning query results to the client.
specs.name: character_set_results

specs.description: Partitions the adaptive hash index search system.
specs.name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts

specs.description: Whether statements that create new tables or alter the structure of existing tables enforce the requirement that tables have a primary key.
specs.name: sql_require_primary_key

specs.description: When set to PARTIAL_JSON, this option enables a space-efficient row-based binary log format for UPDATE statements that modify a JSON value using only the functions JSON_SET, JSON_REPLACE, and JSON_REMOVE. For such updates, only the modified parts of the JSON document are included in the binary log, so small changes of big documents may need significantly less space.
specs.name: binlog_row_value_options

specs.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for attempts to acquire metadata locks
specs.name: lock_wait_timeout

specs.description: Control the length of time (in seconds) that STOP SLAVE waits before timing out by setting this variable.
specs.name: rpl_stop_slave_timeout

specs.description: Controls the type conversion mode in effect on the slave when using row-based replication
specs.name: slave_type_conversions

specs.description: After inserting delayed_insert_limit delayed rows, the INSERT DELAYED handler thread checks whether there are any SELECT statements pending. If so, it allows them to execute before continuing to insert delayed rows.
specs.name: delayed_insert_limit

specs.description: Specifies whether flushing a page from the InnoDB buffer pool also flushes other dirty pages in the same extent.
specs.name: innodb_flush_neighbors

specs.description: Increase the buffer size to get better index handling used for index blocks (for all reads and multiple writes).
specs.name: key_buffer_size

specs.description: Controls whether table and index stats are updated when getting status information via SHOW STATUS or the INFORMATION_SCHEMA
specs.name: innodb_stats_on_metadata

specs.description: The maximum number of rwlock instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_rwlock_classes

specs.description: The maximum number of statement instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_statement_classes

specs.description: This variable controls whether ALTER TABLE implicitly upgrades temporal columns found to be in pre-5.6.4 format.
specs.name: avoid_temporal_upgrade

specs.description: This is a debug option that is only intended for expert debugging use. It disables checkpoints so that a deliberate server exit always initiates InnoDB recovery.
specs.name: innodb_checkpoint_disabled

specs.description: Controls how to delay INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations when purge operations are lagging
specs.name: innodb_max_purge_lag

specs.description: Turns on one or more counters in the information_schema.innodb_metrics table.
specs.name: innodb_monitor_enable

specs.description: The number of regions that the InnoDB buffer pool is divided into
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_instances

specs.description: Controls the sensitivity of linear read-ahead that InnoDB uses to prefetch pages into the buffer cache.
specs.name: innodb_read_ahead_threshold

specs.description: Defines a limit for the number of tablespace definition objects, both used and unused, that can be kept in the dictionary object cache.
specs.name: tablespace_definition_cache

specs.description: The directory used for temporary files and temporary tables
specs.name: tmpdir

specs.description: The default storage engine for TEMPORARY tables.
specs.name: default_tmp_storage_engine

specs.description: Resets to zero the count value for one or more counters in the information_schema.innodb_metrics table.
specs.name: innodb_monitor_reset

specs.description: The size of blocks that are allocated when doing range optimization.
specs.name: range_alloc_block_size

specs.description: This option controls how the server loads the validate_password plugin at startup.
specs.name: validate-password

specs.description: Defines the maximum amount of CPU usage above which user threads no longer spin while waiting for flushed redo.
specs.name: innodb_log_spin_cpu_pct_hwm

specs.description: The granularity of changes, expressed in units of redo log records, that trigger a purge operation, flushing the changed buffer pool blocks to disk
specs.name: innodb_purge_batch_size

specs.description: This variable controls whether the mysql_native_password built-in authentication plugin supports proxy users.
specs.name: mysql_native_password_proxy_users

specs.description: Enables or disables the Performance Schema
specs.name: performance_schema

specs.description: Defines the number of doublewrite pages to write in a batch.
specs.name: innodb_doublewrite_batch_size

specs.description: Creates a replication ignore filter using the pattern of a table name
specs.name: replicate-wild-ignore-table

specs.description: The size of the cache to hold the SQL statements for the binary log during a transaction.
specs.name: binlog_cache_size

specs.description: The default mode value to use for the WEEK() function.
specs.name: default_week_format

specs.description: Maximum length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: innodb_ft_max_token_size

specs.description: Controls whetther LOCAL is supported for LOAD DATA INFILE
specs.name: local_infile

specs.description: The list of permissible ciphers for encrypted connections that use TLS protocols up through TLSv1.2.
specs.name: ssl_cipher

specs.description: The minimum number of characters that validate_password requires passwords to have.
specs.name: validate_password_length

specs.description: The maximum number of error, warning, and note messages to be stored for display.
specs.name: max_error_count

specs.description: Controls how many microseconds the binary log commit waits before synchronizing the binary log file to disk.
specs.name: binlog_group_commit_sync_delay

specs.description: The transaction completion type (0 - default, 1 - chain, 2 - release)
specs.name: completion_type

specs.description: Controls encryption of undo log data for tables encrypted using the InnoDB tablespace encryption feature.
specs.name: innodb_undo_log_encrypt

specs.description: The maximum number of bytes available for computing statement digests.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_digest_length

specs.description: Sets a soft upper limit for the number of cached stored routines per connection.
specs.name: stored_program_cache

specs.description: The protocols permitted by the server for encrypted connections.
specs.name: tls_version

specs.description: When this option is enabled, information about all deadlocks in InnoDB user transactions is recorded in the mysqld error log.
specs.name: innodb_print_all_deadlocks

specs.description: The maximum number of condition instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_cond_classes

specs.description: Host names are not resolved. All Host column values in the grant tables must be IP numbers or localhost.
specs.name: skip_name_resolve

specs.description: When it is enabled, the server permits no updates except from updates performed by slave threads.
specs.name: read_only

specs.description: Enables or disables checksums for redo log pages.
specs.name: innodb_log_checksums

specs.description: The maximum depth of nested stored program calls for which the Performance Schema maintains statistics.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_statement_stack

specs.description: Creates a replication ignore filter using the name of a table
specs.name: replicate-ignore-table

specs.description: Integer value used to identify the instance in a replication group
specs.name: server_id

specs.description: Defines a limit for the number of stored program definition objects, both used and unused, that can be kept in the dictionary object cache.
specs.name: stored_program_definition_cache

specs.description: Name of the table containing a list of words to ignore when creating an InnoDB FULLTEXT index, in the format db_name/table_name.
specs.name: innodb_ft_user_stopword_table

specs.description: Specifies the page size for all InnoDB tablespaces in a MySQL instance.
specs.name: innodb_page_size

specs.description: Maximum binlog cache size a transaction may use
specs.name: max_binlog_cache_size

specs.description: Maximum amount of memory to use for memory mapping compressed MyISAM files
specs.name: myisam_mmap_size

specs.description: Whether or not batched updates are enabled on replication slaves.
specs.name: slave_allow_batching

specs.description: This variable indicates which storage engines cannot be used to create tables or tablespaces.
specs.name: disabled_storage_engines

specs.description: The number of seconds to wait for more data from a TCP/IP connection before aborting the read.
specs.name: net_read_timeout

specs.description: The number of rows in the setup_actors table.
specs.name: performance_schema_setup_actors_size

specs.description: Whether the server tracks changes to the default schema and notifies the client when changes occur.
specs.name: session_track_schema

specs.description: The maximum number of mutex instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_mutex_classes

specs.description: Whether client connections to the server are required to use some form of secure transport.
specs.name: require_secure_transport

specs.description: Controls default collation for utf8mb4 while replicating implicit utf8mb4 collations.
specs.name: histogram_generation_max_mem_size

specs.description: Specifies that, on MySQL server startup, the InnoDB buffer pool is automatically warmed up by loading the same pages it held at an earlier time.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup

specs.description: Determines Innodb transaction durability
specs.name: innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit

specs.description: The number of rows per thread in the events_waits_history table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_waits_history_size

specs.description: Maximum allowed result length in bytes for the GROUP_CONCAT().
specs.name: group_concat_max_len

specs.description: Server rotates the binlog once it reaches this size
specs.name: max_binlog_size

specs.description: Interrupts the process of restoring InnoDB buffer pool contents triggered by innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup or innodb_buffer_pool_load_now.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_abort

specs.description: Size of the cache that holds a parsed document in memory while creating an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: innodb_ft_cache_size

specs.description: Specifies the maximum delay in milliseconds for the delay imposed by the innodb_max_purge_lag configuration option
specs.name: innodb_max_purge_lag_delay

specs.description: Number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.
specs.name: interactive_timeout

specs.description: Sets the autocommit mode
specs.name: autocommit

specs.description: File for Full Search Stop Words. NULL uses Default, /dev/null to disable Stop Words
specs.name: ft_stopword_file

specs.description: Maximum size for the InnoDB change buffer, as a percentage of the total size of the buffer pool.
specs.name: innodb_change_buffer_max_size

specs.description: Defines the default row format for InnoDB tables (including user-created InnoDB temporary tables).
specs.name: innodb_default_row_format

specs.description: Reserved for future use.
specs.name: transaction_write_set_extraction

specs.description: Number of threads used in parallel to index and tokenize text in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index, when building a search index for a large table.
specs.name: innodb_ft_sort_pll_degree

specs.description: SHOW DATABASES statement is allowed only to users who have the SHOW DATABASES privilege
specs.name: skip_show_database

specs.description: Resets all values (minimum, maximum, and so on) for one or more counters in the information_schema.innodb_metrics table.
specs.name: innodb_monitor_reset_all

specs.description: Allow for chain replication - ingression
specs.name: log_slave_updates

specs.description: This variable determines the size of the cache for the binary log to hold nontransactional statements issued during a transaction.
specs.name: binlog_stmt_cache_size

specs.description: The server's default character set.
specs.name: character_set_server

specs.description: The collation of the connection character set.
specs.name: collation_connection

specs.description: Minimum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: ft_min_word_len

specs.description: If the value of this variable is greater than 0, the MySQL server synchronizes its relay log to disk (using fdatasync()) after every sync_relay_log writes to the relay log.
specs.name: sync_relay_log

specs.description: Automatically scale innodb_buffer_pool_size and innodb_log_file_size based on system memory. Also set innodb_flush_method=O_DIRECT_NO_FSYNC, if supported.
specs.name: innodb_dedicated_server

specs.description: The maximum number of bytes available for computing statement digests.
specs.name: max_digest_length

specs.description: Limits the number of times a stored procedure can be called recursively minimizing the demand on thread stack space.
specs.name: max_sp_recursion_depth

specs.description: Whether SHOW CREATE TABLE output includes comments to flag temporal columns found to be in pre-5.6.4 format.
specs.name: show_old_temporals

specs.description: Immediately warms up the InnoDB buffer pool by loading a set of data pages, without waiting for a server restart.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_now

specs.description: Used if the potential for denial-of-service attacks based on running the server out of memory by preparing huge numbers of statements.
specs.name: max_prepared_stmt_count

specs.description: Uses OS locking instead of internal
specs.name: skip_external_locking

specs.description: The number of rows per thread in the events_transactions_history table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_transactions_history_size

specs.description: The maximum number of rows in the prepared_statements_instances table.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_prepared_statements_instances

specs.description: The number of I/O threads for read operations in InnoDB.
specs.name: innodb_read_io_threads

specs.description: Whether InnoDB returns errors rather than warnings for exceptional conditions.
specs.name: innodb_strict_mode

specs.description: Specifies that a set of stopwords is associated with an InnoDB FULLTEXT index at the time the index is created.
specs.name: innodb_ft_enable_stopword

specs.description: If error 1592 is encountered, controls whether the generated warnings are added to the error log or not.
specs.name: log_statements_unsafe_for_binlog

specs.description: The allocation size of memory blocks that are allocated for objects created during statement parsing and execution. May help resolve fragmentation problems.
specs.name: query_alloc_block_size

specs.description: The number of simultaneous client connections allowed.
specs.name: max_connections

specs.description: This variable should not normally be changed. For use when very little memory is available. Set it to the expected length of statements sent by clients.
specs.name: net_buffer_length

specs.description: The directory path to the innodb log files
specs.name: innodb_log_group_home_dir

specs.description: The write-ahead block size for the redo log, in bytes.
specs.name: innodb_log_write_ahead_size

specs.description: The number of background threads devoted to the InnoDB purge operation
specs.name: innodb_purge_threads

specs.description: This variable specifies the locale that controls the language used to display day and month names and abbreviations.
specs.name: lc_time_names

specs.description: When preparing batches of rows for row-based logging and replication, this variable controls how the rows are searched for matches???that is, whether or not hashing is used for searches using a primary or unique key, using some other key, or using no key at all.
specs.name: slave_rows_search_algorithms

specs.description: The minimum number of numeric (digit) characters that passwords checked by the validate_password plugin must have if the password policy is MEDIUM or stronger.
specs.name: validate_password_number_count

specs.description: How long innodb threads sleep before joining the innodb queue, in microseconds.
specs.name: innodb_thread_sleep_delay

specs.description: Whether the server tracks changes to the session system variables and notifies the client when changes occur.
specs.name: session_track_system_variables

specs.description: Sets the maximum number of transactions that can be processed by a multi-threaded slave before a checkpoint operation is called to update its status as shown by SHOW SLAVE STATUS.
specs.name: slave_checkpoint_group

specs.description: If the value of this variable is greater than 0, a replication slave synchronizes its master.info file to disk (using fdatasync()) after every sync_master_info events.
specs.name: sync_master_info

specs.description: MySQL data directory
specs.name: datadir

specs.description: Number of top matches to use for full-text searches performed using WITH QUERY EXPANSION.
specs.name: ft_query_expansion_limit

specs.description: The default pointer size in bytes, to be used by CREATE TABLE for MyISAM tables when no MAX_ROWS option is specified.
specs.name: myisam_data_pointer_size

specs.description: Selects the source of dependency information from which to assess which transactions can be executed in parallel by the slave's multi-threaded applier. Possible values are COMMIT_ORDER, WRITESET and WRITESET_SESSION.
specs.name: binlog_transaction_dependency_tracking

specs.description: Track changes to the transaction attributes.
specs.name: session_track_transaction_info

specs.description: Timeout in seconds an innodb transaction may wait for a row lock before giving up
specs.name: innodb_lock_wait_timeout

specs.description: The size in bytes of the memory buffer innodb uses to cache data and indexes of its tables
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_size

specs.description: Sets the cutoff point at which MySQL begins adding padding within compressed pages to avoid expensive compression failures.
specs.name: innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct

specs.description: Ignore the innodb_io_capacity setting to be ignored for bursts of I/O activity that occur at checkpoints.
specs.name: innodb_flush_sync

specs.description: The number of seconds to wait for more data from a master/slave connection before aborting the read.
specs.name: slave_net_timeout

specs.description: The number of open tables cache instances.
specs.name: table_open_cache_instances

specs.description: A low value can force MySQL to prefer indexes instead of table scans.
specs.name: max_seeks_for_key

specs.description: Enables InnoDB Adaptive Flushing (default=on for RDS)
specs.name: innodb_adaptive_flushing

specs.description: Whether innodb adaptive hash indexes are enabled or disabled
specs.name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index

specs.description: Specifies whether the InnoDB index statistics produced by the ANALYZE TABLE command are stored on disk.
specs.name: innodb_stats_persistent

specs.description: Maximum allowed cumulated size of stored optimizer traces
specs.name: optimizer_trace_max_mem_size

specs.description: Creates a replication ignore filter using the name of a database
specs.name: replicate-ignore-db

specs.description: Enable or disable the slow query log
specs.name: slow_query_log

specs.description: String to be executed by the server for each client that connects.
specs.name: init_connect

specs.description: Number of words to process during each OPTIMIZE TABLE operation on an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: innodb_ft_num_word_optimize

specs.description: Size of the buffer that is allocated when sorting MyISAM indexes during a REPAIR TABLE or when creating indexes with CREATE INDEX or ALTER TABLE.
specs.name: myisam_sort_buffer_size

specs.description: Whether the server is in offline mode.
specs.name: offline_mode

specs.description: If autocommit = 0, innodb honors LOCK TABLES
specs.name: innodb_table_locks

specs.description: The default storage engine for in-memory internal temporary tables.
specs.name: internal_tmp_mem_storage_engine

specs.description: This variable controls whether updates to a view can be made when the view does not contain all columns of the primary key defined in the underlying table, if the update statement contains a LIMIT clause (Often generated by GUI tools).
specs.name: updatable_views_with_limit

specs.description: Defines directories to scan at startup for tablespace files.
specs.name: innodb_directories

specs.description: Starts the server in read-only mode.
specs.name: innodb_read_only

specs.description: There is a per-transaction memory pool from which various transaction-related allocations take memory. For every allocation that cannot be satisfied from the pool because it has insufficient memory available, the pool is incremented.
specs.name: transaction_prealloc_size

specs.description: Controls whether user-defined functions that have only an xxx symbol for the main function can be loaded
specs.name: allow-suspicious-udfs

specs.description: The number of times a thread waits for an innodb mutex to be freed before the thread is suspended
specs.name: innodb_sync_spin_loops

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented mutex objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_mutex_instances

specs.description: The maximum number of tables for which the Performance Schema maintains lock statistics.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_table_lock_stat

specs.description: The size of the buffer that is allocated when preloading indexes.
specs.name: preload_buffer_size

specs.description: Use tablespaces or files for Innodb.
specs.name: innodb_file_per_table

specs.description: Controls whether timeouts rollback the last statement or the entire transaction
specs.name: innodb_rollback_on_timeout

specs.description: Memory mapping for reading and writing MyISAM tables.
specs.name: myisam_use_mmap

specs.description: Sync binlog (MySQL flush to disk or rely on OS)
specs.name: sync_binlog

specs.description: The maximum number of stored programs for which the Performance Schema maintains statistics.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_program_instances

specs.description: Increments Slow_launch_threads if creating thread takes longer than this many seconds.
specs.name: slow_launch_time

specs.description: Specifies the percentage of the most recently used pages for each buffer pool to read out and dump.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct

specs.description: Defines the number of threads that can be used for parallel clustered index reads.
specs.name: innodb_parallel_read_threads

specs.description: The maximum number of file instruments.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_file_classes

specs.description: Limits the size of the MyISAM cache tree in bytes per thread.
specs.name: bulk_insert_buffer_size

specs.description: The list of operators supported by boolean full-text searches
specs.name: ft_boolean_syntax

specs.description: Controls the heuristics applied during query optimization to prune less-promising partial plans from the optimizer search space.
specs.name: optimizer_prune_level

specs.description: When the rds.optimized_writes parameter is set to AUTO, the DB instance uses RDS Optimized Writes for DB instance classes and engine versions that support it. When this parameter is set to OFF, the DB instance doesn't use RDS Optimized Writes.
specs.name: rds.optimized_writes

specs.description: The InnoDB shutdown mode
specs.name: innodb_fast_shutdown

specs.description: Turns off one or more counters in the information_schema.innodb_metrics table.
specs.name: innodb_monitor_disable

specs.description: Enabling this option causes MySQL to write DDL logs to stderr.
specs.name: innodb_print_ddl_logs

specs.description: Size in bytes of blocks in the key cache.
specs.name: key_cache_block_size

specs.description: Enables or disables Innodb Random Read Ahead
specs.name: innodb_random_read_ahead

specs.description: INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and LOCK TABLE WRITE wait until no pending SELECT. Affects only storage engines that use only table-level locking (MyISAM, MEMORY, MERGE).
specs.name: low_priority_updates

specs.description: A host is blocked from further connections if there are more than this number of interrupted connections
specs.name: max_connect_errors

specs.description: If a replication slave SQL thread fails to execute a transaction because of an InnoDB deadlock or because the transaction's execution time exceeded InnoDB's innodb_lock_wait_timeout, it automatically retries slave_transaction_retries times before stopping with an error.
specs.name: slave_transaction_retries

specs.description: Row-based, Statement-based or Mixed replication
specs.name: binlog_format

specs.description: Controls default collation for utf8mb4 while replicating implicit utf8mb4 collations.
specs.name: default_collation_for_utf8mb4

specs.description: The number of threads that can commit at the same time.
specs.name: innodb_commit_concurrency

specs.description: Sets the cutoff point at which MySQL begins adding padding within compressed pages to avoid expensive compression failures.
specs.name: innodb_compression_level

specs.description: The number of rows in the events_waits_history_long table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_waits_history_long_size

specs.description: The path name of the dictionary file used by the validate_password plugin for checking passwords.
specs.name: validate_password_dictionary_file

specs.description: Maximum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: ft_max_word_len

specs.description: Controls encryption of redo log data for tables encrypted using the InnoDB tablespace encryption feature.
specs.name: innodb_redo_log_encrypt

specs.description: Defines the percentage of tablespace file segment pages reserved as empty pages
specs.name: innodb_segment_reserve_factor

specs.description: Enforces restrictions on stored functions / triggers - logging for replication.
specs.name: log_bin_trust_function_creators

specs.description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a non-interactive TCP/IP or UNIX File connection before closing it.
specs.name: wait_timeout

specs.description: Needed for 5.6.7
specs.name: explicit_defaults_for_timestamp

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented thread objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_thread_instances

specs.description: Tells the slave server not to start the slave threads when the server starts.
specs.name: skip-slave-start

specs.description: Don't ignore character set information sent by the client.
specs.name: character-set-client-handshake

specs.description: Maximum number of simultaneous connections allowed to any given MySQL account.
specs.name: max_user_connections

specs.description: Number of iterations for which InnoDB keeps the previously calculated snapshot of the flushing state, controlling how quickly adaptive flushing responds to changing workloads.
specs.name: innodb_flushing_avg_loops

specs.description: Splits an internal data structure used to coordinate threads, for higher concurrency in workloads with large numbers of waiting threads.
specs.name: innodb_sync_array_size

specs.description: Timeout for regular expressions matches, in steps of the match engine, typically on the order of milliseconds.
specs.name: regexp_time_limit

specs.description: Controls the point at which a semisynchronous replication master waits for slave acknowledgment of transaction receipt before returning a status to the client that committed the transaction.
specs.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_point

specs.description: The server time zone
specs.name: time_zone

specs.description: The total memory allocated, in bytes, for the InnoDB FULLTEXT search index cache for all tables.
specs.name: innodb_ft_total_cache_size

specs.description: Limits the number of such queries per minute that can be written to the slow query log.
specs.name: log_throttle_queries_not_using_indexes

specs.description: Defines a limit for the number of schema definition objects, both used and unused, that can be kept in the dictionary object cache.
specs.name: schema_definition_cache

specs.description: Enables a tracker for capturing GTIDs and returning them in the OK packet.
specs.name: session_track_gtids

specs.description: Controls how statements are traced.
specs.name: optimizer_trace

specs.description: After this many write locks, allow some pending read lock requests to be processed in between.
specs.name: max_write_lock_count

specs.description: Specifies the approximate percentage of the InnoDB buffer pool used for the old block sublist.
specs.name: innodb_old_blocks_pct

specs.description: Location of error log.
specs.name: log_error

specs.description: Increased size might help improve perf for complex queries (i.e. Reduces server memory allocation)
specs.name: query_prealloc_size

specs.description: A fully qualified path to the private RSA key used for authentication.
specs.name: caching_sha2_password_private_key_path

specs.description: The basename for the relay log.
specs.name: relay-log

specs.description: The minimum number of nonalphanumeric characters that passwords checked by the validate_password plugin must have if the password policy is MEDIUM or stronger.
specs.name: validate_password_special_char_count

specs.description: The character set used for literals that do not have a character set introducer and for number-to-string conversion.
specs.name: character_set_connection

specs.description: Whether to write error log output to syslog.
specs.name: log_syslog

specs.description: Catch SELECT statements where keys are not used properly and would probably take a long time.
specs.name: max_join_size

specs.description: The number of rows in the events_stages_history_long table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_stages_history_long_size

specs.description: When the slow query log is enabled and the output destination as FILE, additional information related to the slow query is written to the slow query log file. TABLE output is unaffected.
specs.name: log_slow_extra

specs.description: The maximum value of the points_per_circle argument to the ST_Buffer_Strategy() function.
specs.name: max_points_in_geometry

specs.description: Controls optimizer behavior.
specs.name: optimizer_switch

specs.description: Controls the offset on trace retention.
specs.name: optimizer_trace_offset

specs.description: Whether the server logs full or minimal rows with row-based replication.
specs.name: binlog_row_image

specs.description: Controls whether metadata is logged using FULL or MINIMAL format. FULL causes all metadata to be logged; MINIMAL means that only metadata actually required by slave is logged. Default: MINIMAL.
specs.name: binlog_row_metadata

specs.description: Controls where to store query logs
specs.name: log_output

specs.description: Creates a replication filter using the pattern of a table name
specs.name: replicate-wild-do-table

specs.description: When this variable has a value of 1 (the default), the server automatically grants the EXECUTE and ALTER ROUTINE privileges to the creator of a stored routine, if the user cannot already execute and alter or drop the routine.
specs.name: automatic_sp_privileges

specs.description: The maximum number of indexes for which the Performance Schema maintains statistics.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_index_stat

specs.description: Specifies how to generate and verify the checksum stored in each disk block of each InnoDB tablespace.
specs.name: innodb_checksum_algorithm

specs.description: The number of threads that can enter innodb concurrently
specs.name: innodb_thread_concurrency

specs.description: Number of equality ranges when the optimizer should switch from using index dives to index statistics.
specs.name: eq_range_index_dive_limit

specs.description: Suppress behavior to overwrite MyISAM file created in DATA DIRECTORY or INDEX DIRECTORY.
specs.name: keep_files_on_create

specs.description: The number of rows in the users table.
specs.name: performance_schema_users_size

specs.description: If the thread stack size is too small, it limits the complexity of the SQL statements that the server can handle, the recursion depth of stored procedures, and other memory-consuming actions.
specs.name: thread_stack

specs.description: Intended for use with master-to-master replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns
specs.name: auto_increment_increment

specs.description: Prevents execution of statements that cannot be logged in a transactionally safe manner
specs.name: enforce_gtid_consistency

specs.description: The number of rows per thread in the events_statements_history table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_statements_history_size

specs.description: Avoids disk reads when reading rows in sorted order following a key-sort operation. Large values can improve ORDER BY perf.
specs.name: read_rnd_buffer_size

specs.description: Immediately records the pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now

specs.description: Defines the maximum average log flush time beyond which user threads no longer spin while waiting for flushed redo.
specs.name: innodb_log_wait_for_flush_spin_hwm

specs.description: When innodb_stats_include_delete_marked is enabled, ANALYZE TABLE considers delete-marked records when recalculating statistics.
specs.name: innodb_stats_include_delete_marked

specs.description: If this option is enabled, a user cannot create new MySQL users by using the GRANT statement unless the user has the INSERT privilege for the mysql.user table or any column in the table.
specs.name: safe-user-create

specs.description: For SQL window functions, determines whether to enable inversion optimization for moving window frames also for floating values.
specs.name: windowing_use_high_precision

specs.description: Enabling this variable causes the master to examine checksums when reading from the binary log.
specs.name: master_verify_checksum

specs.description: The maximum number of opened table objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_table_handles

specs.description: The path name of the process ID file. This file is used by other programs such as MySQLd_safe to determine the server's process ID.
specs.name: pid_file

specs.description: The increment size (in MB) for extending the size of an auto-extending tablespace file when it becomes full
specs.name: innodb_autoextend_increment

specs.description: Defines what MySQL considers long queries
specs.name: long_query_time

specs.description: The number of the port on which the server listens for TCP/IP connections.
specs.name: port

specs.description: Abort a recursive common table expression if it does more than this number of iterations.
specs.name: cte_max_recursion_depth

specs.description: Number of times a thread can enter and leave Innodb before it is subject to innodb-thread-concurrency
specs.name: innodb_concurrency_tickets

specs.description: This value by default is small, to catch large (possibly incorrect) packets. Must be increased if using large BLOB columns or long strings. As big as largest BLOB.
specs.name: max_allowed_packet

specs.description: If nontransactional statements within a transaction require more than this many bytes of memory, the server generates an error.
specs.name: max_binlog_stmt_cache_size

specs.description: Location of the mysql slow query log file.
specs.name: slow_query_log_file

specs.description: The maximum number of transactions to wait for before aborting the current delay as specified by binlog-group-commit-sync-delay.
specs.name: binlog_group_commit_sync_no_delay_count

specs.description: The file system character set.
specs.name: character_set_filesystem

specs.description: Lets InnoDB load tables at startup that are marked as corrupted
specs.name: innodb_force_load_corrupted

specs.description: Minimum length of words that are stored in an InnoDB FULLTEXT index.
specs.name: innodb_ft_min_token_size

specs.description: Specifies the file that holds the list of page numbers produced by innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown or innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now.
specs.name: innodb_buffer_pool_filename

specs.description: The number of table definitions that can be stored in the definition cache
specs.name: table_definition_cache

specs.description: The number of rows in the events_transactions_history_long table.
specs.name: performance_schema_events_transactions_history_long_size

specs.description: The number of rows in the hosts table.
specs.name: performance_schema_hosts_size

specs.description: The number of slave acknowledgments the master must receive per transaction before proceeding.
specs.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_for_slave_count

specs.description: The minimum number of lowercase and uppercase characters that passwords checked by the validate_password plugin must have if the password policy is MEDIUM or stronger.
specs.name: validate_password_mixed_case_count

specs.description: Indicates the status of the Event Scheduler
specs.name: event_scheduler

specs.description: Allows InnoDB to automatically adjust the value of innodb_thread_sleep_delay up or down according to the current workload.
specs.name: innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay

specs.description: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE.
specs.name: innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages

specs.description: Frees up resources and synchronize unflushed data to disk. Recommended only on systems with minimal resources.
specs.name: flush_time

specs.description: The maximum number of instrumented table objects.
specs.name: performance_schema_max_table_instances

specs.description: Whether client connections to the server are required to use some form of secure transport.
specs.name: super_read_only

specs.description: Specifies the maximum percentage that can be reserved as free space within each compressed page, allowing room to reorganize the data and modification log within the page when a compressed table or index is updated and the data might be recompressed.
specs.name: innodb_compression_pad_pct_max

specs.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory (in bytes) the TempTable storage engine is permitted to allocate from memory-mapped temporary files before it starts storing data to InnoDB internal temporary tables on disk.
specs.name: temptable_max_mmap

specs.description: Enables automatic relay log recovery immediately following server startup.
specs.name: relay_log_recovery

specs.description: Controls whether the server autogenerates SSL key and certificate files in the data directory, if they do not already exist.
specs.name: auto_generate_certs

specs.description: How many seconds an INSERT DELAYED handler thread should wait for INSERT statements before terminating.
specs.name: delayed_insert_timeout

specs.description: The minimum number of days that need to pass before a password can be reused. Set to 0 (the default) to turn the checks off.
specs.name: password_reuse_interval

specs.description: The limit on memory consumption for the range optimizer.
specs.name: range_optimizer_max_mem_size
